Description: Fragment of neck of East Greek black-figured pottery krater. Inside glazed down to shoulder turn, with added red and white lines. Outside, between bands, two facing ducks amid incised and blob rosettes; side of panel to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Joins 19867 (glue remains) and almost certainly from same vase as 19869 and 19870. From a ring-handled dinos or krater. See 19869.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 15, no. 45a pl. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.488)
